functions.name: exec
functions.description:
Executes the specified string command in a separate process.
 This function does not allow arguments to be passed to
 the command.
functions.summary: Executes the specified string command in a separate process.

parameters.name: cmd
parameters.description: command to be executed (without arguments)

returns.description: the result of the execution as an element as shown in the documentation of this module. The exit-code element returns the exit code of the child process. For POSIX compliant platforms: returns the process exit code. If process is terminated or stopped: 128 + termination signal code. For Windows platforms: returns the return value of the process or the exit or terminate process specified value.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">process:PROC01 if an error occurred while communicating with the executed process.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: exec
functions.signature: ($cmd as xs:string, $args as xs:string*) as element(process:result) external
functions.description:
Executes the specified string command in a separate process.
 Each of the strings in the sequence passed in as the second
 argument is passed as an argument to the executed command.
functions.summary: Executes the specified string command in a separate process.

parameters.name: cmd
parameters.description: command to be executed (without arguments)

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: the arguments passed to the executed command (e.g. "-la")

returns.description: the result of the execution as an element as shown in the documentation of this module. The exit-code element returns the exit code of the child process. For POSIX compliant platforms: returns the process exit code. If process is terminated or stopped: 128 + termination signal code. For Windows platforms: returns the return value of the process or the exit or terminate process specified value.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">process:PROC01 if an error occurred while communicating with the executed process.</xqdoc:error>
